intro: Anthobembix, commonly known as the orchid bee. Anthobembix is a genus of bees belonging to the family Apidae, known for their role in pollination. These bees are characterized by their metallic blue or green coloration and are often found in tropical and subtropical regions. They are important pollinators of various flowering plants, including orchids. Their behavior and morphology make them a subject of interest in both ecological and evolutionary studies.
